parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 1st Person Singular
str2: To plant, set. From a derivative of phuo; to set out in the earth, i.e. Implant; figuratively, to instil doctrine.
Apollos, a Jew of Alexandria. Probably from the same as Apollonia; Apollos, an Israelite.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To cause to drink, give to drink; irrigate, water. From a derivative of the alternate of pino; to furnish drink, irrigate.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
A deity, especially the supreme Divinity; figuratively, a magistrate; by Hebraism, very.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: (a) I cause to increase, become greater (b) I increase, grow. A prolonged form of a primary verb; to grow, i.e. Enlarge.
